__app__.info: Python wrapper for git. It applies a git workflow close to GitFlow model from nvie.com. It uses semantic versioning 2.0.0

commit.info: add a default commit message if commit is needed

debug.info: debug mode in order to display all processing steps. Mainly use for testing

disable_validator.info: disable gitframe validator. This function should be used only to test and write the deploy_release script. For instance: gitframe --dv --pr v1.0.0

index.info: Repository Index For multiple package with same name. If index is not given, then index is 1

init.info: Create new git project with master and develop branches.

path_src.info: path of the git project, it doesn't have to be the root path

shared.info: set shared option with 'git config core.sharedRepository'

set_origin.info: Set given path as origin to project. If no project selected then current path is consider the project

synchronize_project.info: branching model validator is applied and all branches are synchronized

sync.info: Push select branches from project to origin. If no branches are selected then all branches are sent.

tag.info: Create a git version tag. If no tag is given then a version file path has to be provided.

test.info: launch tests. Tests are by default in debug mode. select Mode is either 'local_path' or 'ssh_url'. 'ssh_url' mode mocks a ssh server on local.

update.info: go to git directories, commit if needed and then for each branch in each folder push to origin.

update_gitframe.info: this is for gitframe developers only. This command is needed in order to allow development on gitframe with gitframe. It copies the src code to a temporary folder and execute gitframe from this folder with the remaining parameters. ex: ./gitframe.py --ug="--pr" will execute /tmp/test-gf/bin/gitframe.py --pr. NOTE: --test command does not need --update_gitframe and it must be executed from the main source code.

version_file.info: Can a json file with a 'version' key or a text file with version as first line
